hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Neutral Reversion via Extreme Fear & Volatility Contraction
hypothesis_content.statement: During a STRESS regime, if the Crypto Fear & Greed Index drops below 15 (Extreme Fear) and the 2-day realized volatility is >2x the 20-day realized volatility, a subsequent contraction in 2-day volatility to below the 20-day level will trigger a sharp, 2-day mean reversion rally and a transition back to NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: STRESS regimes characterized by panic selling and high short-term volatility. Extreme fear combined with a spike and then rapid decline in volatility indicates a selling climax and exhaustion. The market typically snaps back to a more rational, neutral state quickly.
entry_conditions: BTC 2-day realized volatility >= (2 * BTC 20-day realized volatility)
BTC 2-day realized volatility subsequently falls to < BTC 20-day realized volatility

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain from entry (long position) or Regime == NEUTRAL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: After volatility contraction, price continues to decline or moves sideways for >5 days without a significant rally (>5%) or regime change.
